metadata.value: The University College of Wales magazine

value.@value: Published in Aberystwyth by the University College of Wales. Printed in Oswestry by Woodall and Venables until June 1880, in Aberystwyth by J. Gibson at the Cambrian News until June 1891, in Birmingham by J. G. Hammond and Company until June 1895, and subsequently in Aberystwyth by J. and J. Gibson at the Cambrian News Office.

Cyhoeddwyd yn Aberystwyth gan Coleg Prifysgol Cymru. Argraffwyd yng Nghroesoswallt gan Woodall a Venables tan Fehefin 1880, yn Aberystwyth gan J. Gibson, Cambrian News, tan Fehefin 1891, ym Mirmingham gan J. G. Hammond a'i Chwmni tan Fehefin 1895, ac yna yn Aberystwyth gan J. ac J. Gibson, Swyddfa'r Cambrian News.
This content has been digitised by The National Library of Wales
Digidwyd y cynnwys hwn gan Lyfrgell Gendlaethol Cymru

description.@value: The periodical of the University College of Wales, Aberystwyth, which published articles on subjects such as literature, education, history, science and religion, alongside college news. Originally a bimonthly publication it was published monthly from October 1889 onwards. Amongst the periodical's editors were J. Mortimer Angus, John Edward Lloyd and the scholar and author, Lilian Winstanley (g. 1875). Associated titles: The Dragon (1903).

Cylchgrawn Coleg Prifysgol, Cymru, Aberystwyth, a oedd yn cyhoeddi erthyglau ar bynciau megis llenyddiaeth, addysg, hanes, gwyddoniaeth a chrefydd, ynghyd a newyddion o'r coleg. Yn wreiddiol yn gylchgrawn daufisol gafodd ei gyhoeddi'n fisol o Hydref 1889 ymlaen. Ymhlith golygyddion y cylchgrawn oedd J. Mortimer Angus, John Edward Lloyd a'r ysgolhaig ac awdur, Lilian Winstanley (b. 1875). Teitlau cysylltiol: The Dragon (1903).
